content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Everything is ok

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like the level of complexity

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Défi fun et simple
Contexte original

It took me a bit to understand the wording of this problem...
Instead of saying "Determine the quantities you need to produce your orders", try saying something along the lines of "Determine the total amount of each ingredient needed to fulfill your orders".

There's an error in the solution!
The formula for the wheat used by the choquettes is chouquettes * (18 / chouquettes_recipe["Wheat"])
chouquettes_recipe["Wheat"] is 60, so I'll put that in.
chouquettes * (18 /60)
or
chouquettes*.3
Implying .3 grams of wheat per chouquette instead of 10/3 grams.
The same mistake happened for butter.

Goal
* Paragraph 1: Please mention that the quantities of the ingredients are <<rounded up separately for each order>> before summing up to get the total quantities.

* Alternatively, you may want to require the rounding up to be done only once at the end to be more logical.

Input
* Your description doesn't match the input, and doesn't contain/present all the required information properly (line number, variable type, variable name, variable description).

Please rewrite as follows:

<<Line 1>>: An integer [[order]] for the number of orders.
<<Next [[order]] lines>>: Each line contains 3 space-separated integers [[Croissant]], [[Chouquettes]] and [[Brioches]] for the quantities ordered.

Output
* The rounding requirement has been mentioned after the above amendment in Goal section. Also note that we want "rounding up" instead of mere "rounding". For example, if we need 1.2 egg, the output should be 2 eggs instead of 1 egg.

Hence, please rewrite the entire section as follows:

<<Line 1>>: 3 space-separated integers for the quantities required of <<wheat>>, <<butter>> and <<eggs>> in g (grams).

Constraints
* All ">=" should be changed to "<=".

0 >= A <= 1000 means 0 is greater than or equal to A and A is less than or equal to 1000. Combining the two conditions, A can only be 0 or negative.

Cases / Code
* All answers seem to be wrong. Take Test 1 for example:

10 croissant require 210 g of wheat, 105 g of butter, 0 egg
30 chouquettes require 100 g of wheat, 67 g of butter, 2 eggs
3 Brioches require 176 g of wheat, 87 g of butter, 3 eggs
Total should be 486 g of wheat, 259 g of butter and 5 eggs (hence "486 259 5" instead of "394 206 5").

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer").

Thanks.
Okay, everything should be fixed now, thanks

Thank you. Still some issues:

Stub generator
* You don't need the quotation marks. Please remove them.

Solution code
* You round (instead of round up) the quantities of wheat and butter.

* You round the quantities of wheat and butter for **each order**, but you round up the quantity of eggs after considering **all orders**. The approaches are not consistent.

As mentioned in my last comment, please choose either to round up first for each order then sum up, or sum up all the orders (with no rounding) then round up only at the very end.

Thanks.

You don't have to feel dumb or sorry. We improve ourselves by learning from mistakes.

As you've chosen to do all the rounding at the end, please change the middle paragraph (Goal section) as:

The quantities of the ingredients required are summed up for <<all the orders>>, before rounding up at the end for output.

Also, in the code, please replace the two "round" with "math.ceil".

Thanks again.

Okay ! 
The code, goal and case/answers are fixed !
Thanks
